alert.note: Alert for Lee; Macon; Tallapoosa (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 02 at 6:46PM CDT by NWS Birmingham
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Lee, northeastern Macon and southeastern Tallapoosa Counties through 730 PM CDT... At 646 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Bleecker to near Notasulga. Movement was east at 10 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Auburn, Opelika, Tuskegee, Notasulga, Smiths, Smiths Station, Waverly, Beulah, Beans Mill, Auburn University, Tuskegee National Forest, Beauregard, Bleecker, Griffen Mill, Loachapoka, Robert G. Pitts Airport, I 85 Rest Area, Uphapee Creek, Monterey Heights and Chewacla State Park. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 800 PM CDT for east central Alabama.
